title: Equivalent resistance - R1 in parallel with R2-R3

content.question: The figure shows a portion of a circuit comprised of three resistors, with resistances as indicated. What is the equivalent resistance of the set of resistors in the figure?

choices.label: <math alttext="R sub 1, end sub, plus R sub 2, end sub, plus R sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="R sub 1, end sub, plus open parenthesis, the fraction 1 over R sub 2, end fraction, plus the fraction 1 over R sub 3, close parenthesis, raised to the negative 1 power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, the fraction 1 over R sub 1, end fraction, plus the fraction 1 over R sub 2, end fraction, plus the fraction 1 over R sub 3, close parenthesis, raised to the negative 1 power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, the fraction 1 over R sub 1, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator R sub 2, end sub, plus R sub 3, end fraction, close parenthesis, raised to the negative 1 power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open parenthesis, the fraction 1 over R sub 1, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator R sub 2, end sub, plus R sub 3, end fraction, close parenthesis, raised to the negative 1 power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
